SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Bookshelf

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Bookshelf
public class Bookshelf extends Object
This class represents the Player's bookshelf. It contains a series of methods to access the values of bookshelf's columns, rows and others attributes. It also contains methods to allow the bookshelf to be modified by active players in the lobby during the Game (these are used mainly for adding or removing Tiles from the bookshelf).
See Also:

  • Tile
  • Game

    • isColumnFull

      public boolean isColumnFull(int column)
      Controls if the current column still has free positions to insert other Tiles.
      Parameters:
      column - is the column that we want to check.
      Returns:
      true if the column is full, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • Tile

    • score

      public int score() throws Exception
      Evaluate the total points assigned to every group of tiles of the same color in the board. The Bookshelf is split in the different color-groups and then by the number of element of each group we assign the points to. If the number of Tiles is below the first goal available, the player doesn't get any points. If the number of tiles is over the last goal available, the player get an amount of points equals to those of the last goal.
      Returns:
      score is the number of points assigned to the group.
      Throws:
      Exception - print a message that signals that the total of points for the current Bookshelf have not been set.
      See Also:
      • Tile

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Used to generate the matrix representing the Bookshelf
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the substring generated from the StringBuilder instanced in the first part of the method, describing the current state of tiles in rows/columns.
